questions.question_text: A network engineer is testing a website to ensure it is compatible with IPv6. After attempting to ping the website by its IPv6 address, the engineer determines that the DNS has not been set up properly. Which of the following should the network engineer complete to resolve this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Is it a typo? I’m assuming they meant “AAAA” and not “AAA”

Selected Answer: C
What is an AAAA Record? IPv6 Address Mapping Setup
The AAAA record (or quad A record) points your hostname to an IPv6 address. The record AAAA specifies IP address (IPv6) for a given host. In other words, it resolves a domain name (or points the domain name) to the correct location by means of the IPv6 address
At present days, the DNS AAAA record is not as popular as the A record. Yet, its implementation is rapidly increasing as the adoption of IPv6 is expanding. The trend shows that IPv6 will become the most commonly used IP address version in the future.
The AAAA record has the following look in your ClouDNS Control Panel:
Host:--------------------------Type:--------------------Points to:------------------------TTL
hostname.com--------AAAA-----------------ipv6:of:your:web::site----------1 Hour
https://www.cloudns.net/wiki/article/11/

Selected Answer: C
Add a new AAA record.

questions.question_text: A small coffee shop wants to set up multiple 2.4GHz wireless access points. The access points will support a large number of users, and the network technician wants to mitigate interference as much as possible. Which of the following is the number of 22MHz channels that the equipment can support?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
In the 2.4 GHz band, there are 11 channels. Each channel is 22 MHz wide, but they overlap significantly. Only three channels (1, 6, and 11) are considered non-overlapping.

Selected Answer: C
In the 2.4GHz band, with a channel width of 22MHz, you can technically support 14 channels as defined by the IEEE 802.11 standards, but due to channel overlap, only a few channels (typically 1, 6, and 11) can be used without significant interference with each other.

questions.question_text: A company is purchasing a 40Gbps broadband connection service from an ISP. Which of the following should most likely be configured on the 10G switch to take advantage of the new service?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Link Aggregation is a technique used in networking to combine multiple physical network connections into a single logical link. This improves bandwidth, redundancy, and fault tolerance. It is commonly used in Ethernet networks and is also known as port bonding, trunking, or NIC teaming.

Selected Answer: A
A. DNS cache poisoning 

Also known as DNS poisoning, an attack that adds or changes information in a DNS server’s cache to point hostnames to incorrect IP addresses, under the attacker’s control. When a client requests an IP address from this DNS server for a Web site, the poisoned server hands out an IP address of an attacker machine, not the legitimate site. When the client subsequently visits the attacker site, they become vulnerable to a number of threats including malware.

Selected Answer: A
The correct answer is:
A. DNS poisoning.

DNS poisoning (or DNS spoofing) involves corrupting the DNS cache or records to redirect users from a legitimate website to a fraudulent or malicious website. This type of attack can deceive users and potentially capture sensitive information.

Selected Answer: A
It is DNS poisoning, the DNS is generally what the user is clicking on in good faith.

Selected Answer: D
DNS poisoning redirects your URL to a malicious website when trying to access a regular one,

The correct answer is A. DNS poisoning 

DNS poisoning is a type of cyber attack that specifically causes users to be redirected to malicious websites when they attempt to access legitimate ones.

questions.question_text: Which of the following attacks can cause users who are attempting to access a company website to be directed to an entirely different website?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
I need to read the question better! I was stuck between C and D until I realized the question asked for two answers. C and D folks

Selected Answer: CD
ESP = provides confidentiality through encryption
AH = provides authentication through IP headers and their payloads.

Selected Answer: CD
ESP provides confidentiality through encryption and AH provides authentication through IP headers and their payloads.

questions.question_text: Which of the following are the main differences between ESP and AH? (Choose two.)

choices.A: AH provides confidentiality through the use of encryption.
choices.F: ESP provides data origin authorization over shared secret.
choices.C: ESP provides confidentiality through the use of encryption.
choices.D: AH provides authentication for IP headers and their payloads.
choices.B: ESP provides authentication for IP headers and their payloads.
choices.E: AH provides data origin authorization over shared secret.
